gpar.model module¶

class gpar.model.GPAR(replace=False, impute=False, x_ind=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Basic GPAR model.

Parameters

  • replace (bool, optional) – Condition on the predictive mean instead of the data. Defaults to False.

  • impute (bool, optional) – Impute missing data points with the predictive mean to make the data set closed downwards. Defaults to False.

  • x_ind (tensor, optional) – Locations of inducing points for a sparse approximation. Defaults to None.

replace¶

See the argument replace.

Type

bool

impute¶

See the argument impute.

Type

bool

layers¶

Layers of the model.

Type

list

sparse¶

Use a sparse approximation?

Type

bool

x_ind¶

Locations of inducing points if a sparse approximation is used.

Type

tensor or None

add_layer(model_constructor)[source]¶

Add a layer.

Parameters

model_constructor (function) – Constructor of the model, which should return a tuple containing the latent and noise process.

Returns

Updated GPAR model.

Return type

gpar.GPAR

copy()[source]¶

Create a new GPAR model with the same configuration.

Returns

New GPAR model with the same configuration.

Return type

gpar.GPAR

logpdf(x, y, w, only_last_layer=False, sample_missing=False, return_inputs=False, x_ind=None, outputs=None)[source]¶

Compute the logpdf.

Parameters

  • x (tensor) – Inputs.

  • y (tensor) – Outputs.

  • w (tensor) – Weights.

  • only_last_layer (bool, optional) – Compute the logpdf for only the last layer. Defaults to False.

  • sample_missing (bool, optional) – Sample missing data to compute an unbiased estimate of the pdf, not logpdf. Defaults to False.

  • return_inputs (bool, optional) – Instead return the inputs and inputs for the inducing points with previous outputs concatenated. This can be used to perform precomputation. Defaults to False.

  • x_ind (tensor, optional) – Inputs for the inducing points. This can be used to resume a computation. Defaults to model.GPAR.x_ind.

  • outputs (list[int], optional) – Only compute the logpdf for a subset of outputs. The list specifies the indices of the outputs. Defaults to computing the logpdf for all outputs.

Returns

Logpdf. If return_inputs is set to True, instead return a

tuple containing the inputs and the inputs for the inducing points with previous outputs concatenated

Return type

scalar

sample(x, w, latent=False)[source]¶

Sample.

Parameters

  • x (tensor) – Inputs to sample at.

  • w (tensor) – Weights.

  • latent (bool, optional) – Sample latent function. Defaults to False.

Returns

Sample.

Return type

tensor
